passages.text: USA | Aerospace & Defense
JEF Aero, Def and Airline Events: JEF Industrials Conference

We gear up for the Jefferies Industrials Conference this week, taking place from Sep 3- 4. During the conference, we are lucky to host mgmt dinners with PSN, TXT, and WWD on Sept 2 and LHX, LOAR, TDY, and VOYG on Sept 3. There are several industry events in DC followed by NYC NDR w/ LDOS and a TDG HQ visit w/ CEO Michael Lisman in Cleveland on Sept 24 and a stop over to Flex HQ. In Oct, we look forward to AUSA and NBAA.
The A&D and Airlines team has consolidated its event on our website!
https://jefaero.open- exchange.net/welcome
- Sept 2-3: Jefferies Industrials Conference Management Dinners - NYC

- Sept 2:  - Textron Inc. (TXT): David Rosenberg, CFO; Scott Hegstrom, IR  - Woodward, Inc. (WWD): Bill Lacey, CFO; Dan Provaznik, IR  - Parsons (PSN): Matt Oflos, CFO; Mark Fialkowski, President, Infrastructure North America
1. Voyager Technologies (VOYG): Phil De Sousa, CFO; Kevin Kulak, Exec Vice President; Adi Padva, SVP, Corp Dev & IR
2. L3Harris (LHX): Chris Kubasik, CEO; Ken Bedingfield, CFO
3. Loar Holdings (LOAR): Dirkson Charles, CEO; Glenn D'Alessandro, CFO; Brett Milgrim, Executive Co-Chairman
4. Teledyne (TDY): Jason VanWees, Vice Chairman

- Sept 3-4: Jefferies Industrials Conference - NYC- Sept 9-10: JETNET iQ Summit - Washington, DC- Sep 9-11: US Chamber of Commerce Global Aerospace Summit - Washington, DC- NEW Sep 9-12: JSEI 2025 - London, UK- Sep 17: NDRw/ Leidos (LDOS) - NYC- Sep 18: New Wings Club Luncheon w/ oneworld CEO, Nat Pieper- NYC- Sep 22-24: Air, Space & Cyber Conference - National Harbor, MD- Sep 24: TDG HQ Visit w/ Incoming CEO, Michael Lisman + Flexjet HQ Visit w/ CEO, Michael Shvestro - Cleveland, OH

- Oct 13-14: The Aerospace Event - Washington, DC- Oct 13-16: AUSA Annual Meeting & Exposition - Washington, DC- NEW Oct 14-16: NBAA Business Aviation Convention & Exhibition - Las Vegas, NV- NEW Oct 14-16: MRO Europe - London, UK- NEW Nov 12-13: Jefferies & McKinsey Canada Defense Conference - Toronto- Nov 18-19: Jefferies Miami Consumer Conference - Miami, FL- Dec 11: The Wings Club Luncheon w/ LUV CEO, Bob Jordan - NYC
- Mar 8-10, 2026: ISTAT Americas - San Diego, CA
- Friday, Sept 5: NYC- Tues, Sept 9: Baltimore- Thur, Oct 2: Boston

- Thurs, Sep 11: All Things Defense w/ Aviation Week's Brian Everstine (Link)- Mon, Sep 29: All Things Army w/ Former ASA (ALT) - Young Bang (Link)- Thu, Oct 2: Iran Conflict w/AEI's Todd Harrison (Link)- Mon, Oct 6: All Things Business Jets w/ Aviation International News - Chad Trautvetter (Link)- Mon, Oct 27: All Things Navy w/ Mason Autonomy and Robotics Center - Mary "Missy" Cummings (Link)- Thu, Oct 30: Fractional Jet Ownership w/ AirSprint Private Aviation - AirSprint Private Aviation CEO (Link)- Mon, Nov 3: Transforming the Space Power & Manufacturing Landscape w/ CisLunar Industries CTO - Joe Pawelski (Link)- Thurs, Nov 6: All Things Defense w/ the Center for Strategic & International Studies (Link)- Mon, Nov 10: Machine Identity Management w/ Corsha (Link)- Tue, Nov 11: Space Policy & Regulation w/The Office of Space Commerce - Gabriel Swiney Director at the Office of Space Commerce (Link)- Mon, Nov 17: All Things Space w/ Quantum Space (Link)- Thurs, Nov 20: US Defense Budget & Strategy w/ CSBA (Link)- Mon, Dec 1: AI & The Aerospace Landscape w/ Aeroglity CEO - Malcolm Bridgeford (Link)- Mon, Dec 15: National Security & Policy w/The Hoover Institution - Jackie Schneider (Link)
- Mon, Sept 29: AVAV - Albuquerque, NM- Wed, Oct 8: CDRE - NYC- Tue, Oct 14: ERJ - NYC
Please reach out to the team or your Jefferies sales representative to register for Roadshows and Mgmt Meetings.
Management Dinners During Industrials Conference
Date: Tuesday, September 2, 2025, and Wednesday, September 3, 2025
Dinner w/ Voyager Technologies, Inc. (VOYG)
Management Participating: Phil De Sousa, CFO; Kevin Kulak, Exec Vice President; Adi Padva, SVP, Corp Dev & IR
Location: Casa Tua (20 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021)
What We'll Be Watching...
Starlab Critical Design Review and manufacturing timeline Conversion of \(3.6BB\) pipeline
Incremental awards on the \(\) 1\$ BB NGI opportunity to 2043
Dinner w/ Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (TDY)

Management Participating: Jason VanWees, Vice Chairman Time: 6:00 PM ET Location: Casa Tua (20 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021) What We'll Be Watching... Effects of short cycle and macro uncertainty Margin outlook as macro headwinds subside New product acceptance and product development
Dinner w/ Loar Holdings Inc. (LOAR)

Management Participating: Dirkson Charles, CEO; Glenn D'Alessandro, CFO; Brett Milgrim, Executive Co- Chairman; Ian McKillop, IR Time: 6:00 PM ET Location: Casa Tua (20 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021) What We'll Be Watching... M&A Pipeline Content outlook on existing and new platforms OE ramp expectations after conservatism to start the year
Dinner w/ L3Harris Technologies, Inc. (LHX)

Management Participating: Chris Kubasik, CEO; Ken Bedingfield, CFO; Daniel Gittsovich, IR Time: 7:00PM ET Location: Casa Tua (20 E 76th St, New York, NY 10021) What We'll Be Watching... Margin execution and IMS expected recovery Funding outlook in responsive space, radios, cyber, and JADC2 Cost takeout strategy
You are invited to attend the Jefferies Industrials Conference, taking place on Wednesday, September 3, and Thursday, September 4, 2025, at the Westin Times Square in New York City.

The conference will feature presentations, fireside chats, and 1x1 meetings with over 200 public and private industrials companies. This gathering of over 1,400 leading executives, institutional investors, private equity investors, and VCs will address near- and long- term investment opportunities and discuss the current trends driving industrial sectors in the U.S. and internationally.

Participating CompaniesAeroVironment, Inc.Ducommun IncorporatedAerSale CorporationElbit Systems Ltd.Albany International Corp.Embraer S.A.Amentum Holdings, Inc.Epirus, Inc.American Airlines Group Inc.FTAI Aviation Ltd.Astronics CorporationGlobal Crossing Airlines Group Inc.ATI Inc.HawkEye 360, Inc.ATS CorporationHEICO CorporationBlackSky Technology Inc.Hexcel CorporationBlade Air Mobility, Inc.Honeywell International Inc.Bombardier Inc.Howmet Aerospace Inc.Bristow Group Inc.Joby Aviation, Inc.BWX Technologies, Inc.L3Harris Technologies, Inc.Cadre Holdings, Inc.Leonardo DRS, Inc.CAE Inc.Loor Holdings Inc.Carpenter Technology CorporationLockheed Martin CorporationDeutsche Lufthansa AGMDA Space Ltd.

Please note that given overwhelming demand in recent years, attendance for the 2025 conference will be limited and subject to review. Completing the registration request process will be required for consideration.
All Things Defense w/ Aviation Week's Brian Everstine

Current state of the defense landscape Expectations of inflation impact across major programs Outlook of supply base for critical defense technologies Update on manufacturer technologies and developments
Management Attendees: Michael Lisman, Incoming CEO (effective September 30, 2025)
Date: Wednesday September 24, 2025
Location: TransDigm Group, 1350 Euclid Avenue #1600, Cleveland, Ohio 44115

Bio: In May 2025, Mr. Lisman was selected as the next president and CEO of the TransDigm Group, succeeding Kevin Stein, who will officially retire on Sept. 30. Mr. Lisman was appointed Co- Chief Operating Officer in May 2023. Prior to that, he served as Chief Financial Officer from July 2018 to May 2023, Vice President- Mergers and Acquisitions from January 2018 through June 2018, Business Unit Manager for the Air & Fuel Valves business unit at Aero Fluid Products, a wholly owned subsidiary of TransDigm Inc., from January 2017 to January 2018, and the company's Director of Mergers and Acquisitions from November 2015 to January 2017.
American: 9/24 LGA @ 7:40AM to CLE @ 9:23AM
- United: 9/24 EWR @ 7:45AM to CLE @ 9:23AM- Delta: 9/24 LGA @ 8:29AM to CLE @ 10:09PM
- American: 9/24 CLE @ 5:18PM to LGA @ 6:57PM- United: 9/24 CLE @ 5:10PM to EWR @ 6:46PM
All Things Army w/ Former ASA(ALT) - Young Bang
- Current state of the international defense landscape- DoD modernization and key focuses of funding- Outlook of supply base for critical defense technologies
Iran Conflict w/AEI's Todd Harrison

- Challenges in scaling up manufacturing and delivery of defense systems- Current systems deployed by the U.S. and Israel and acceleration of next-gen systems- Defense contractor positioning and demand with respect to the Iran/Israel conflict- Broader implications regarding regional dynamics and oil infrastructure- U.S. domestic and strategic policy implications
All Things Business Jets w/ Aviation International News - Chad Trautvetter

- Business aviation demand and global market trends within the industry- Used business jet market dynamics with expectations for new build and demand sustainability- Implications of used business jet inventory and order momentum- Private aviation market trends, and outlook on charter and fractional operations vs full ownership- Valuations and performance of corporate jet variants
- Dates: Monday, October 13th - Wednesday, October 15th- Location: Walter E. Washington Convention Center - Washington, DC

Background: The Association of the United States Army (AUSA) Annual Meeting & Exposition is the premier land power exposition and professional development forum in North America- and a key event for anyone involved in the defense sector. With over 44,000 attendees, \(750+\) exhibits, and representation from 92 countries, this three- day event brings together the global defense community to shape the future of national security.
Monday, October 13th Booth Tours:

1:15- 2:00PM - Textron (TXT) - Booth #7227 - Hall DE2:00- 2:45PM - Lockheed Martin (LMT) - Booth #6013 - Hall DE3:35- 4:00PM - Honeywell (HON) - Booth #7341 - Hall DE4:05- 4:45PM - Elbit (ESLT) - Booth #6441 - Hall DE
6:00PM Dinner - Douglas Bush - Former Assistant Secretary of the Army for Acquisition, Logistics and Technology
8:00AM Breakfast - Kirk Konert - Managing Partner at AE Industrial and Member of BoDs Across A&D Portfolio Companies

10:00- 10:30AM - Northrop Grumman (NOC) - Booth #1325 - Hall ABC1:00- 1:30PM - CACI (CACI) - Booth #2249 - Hall ABC2:00- 2:45PM - AeroVironment (AVAV) - Booth #3105 - Hall ABC3:00- 4:00PM - General Dynamics (GD, Company Sponsored) - Booth #6027 - Hall DEAmemtum (AMTM) - Booth #1619 - Hall ABCLeidos (LDOS) - Booth #739 - Hall ABCTeledyne FLIR (TDY) - Booth #1003 - Hall ABC
6:00PM Dinner - The Honorable Mike McCord, Former Comptroller of the DoD
Anduril (Private) - Booth #3747 - Hall ABCEpirus (Private) - Booth #7609 - Hall DEShield AI (Private) - Booth #2847 - Hall ABC
Dates: Tuesday, October \(14^{\text{th}}\) - Thursday, October \(16^{\text{th}}\) Location: Las Vegas Convention Center, West Hall - Las Vegas, NV

Background: NBAA- BACE is the most influential business aviation trade show in the United States and features market leaders across the general aviation industry, including business jet OEMs, suppliers, operators, aftermarket suppliers, and eVTOLs, with industry participants providing insight into the market backdrop and new products.
Meetings will be held Tuesday, October 14th in Las Vegas, NV
Meetings with Corporates - Exhibit Hall & Airport Static Displays  - 10AM PT: LOAR Group (LOAR): Dirkson Charles (CEO), Brett Milgrim (Exec Co- Chairman), Glenn D'Alessandro (CFO)
Taxi to Static Display (\~30 mins)
4PM PT: Bombardier: Aircraft Tour Honda Aircraft Company Cirrus
Exhibition Dates: Tuesday, October 14th - Thursday, October 16th
3131 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
To RSVP please contact the Jefferies A&D team or your sales representative:
Dates: Tuesday, October \(14^{\text{th}}\) - Thursday, October \(16^{\text{th}}\)
Location: Excel London - London, UK

Background: MRO Europe is the leading event in the region for the commercial aviation aftermarket, combining a senior level conference and international exhibition. More than \(590+\) solution providers exhibit at the show, which attracts over 11,500 attendees representing airlines, lessors, MROs, OEMs, suppliers and industry experts.
All Things Navy w/ Mason Autonomy and Robotics Center - Mary "Missy" Cummings
Outlook on the Shipbuilding plan under the Trump Administration Current budget request and outlook for future spend
- Implications of government efficiency initiatives and changes at the DoD- Progress and outlook for key Navy programs such as the Columbia and Virginia-class submarines
Transforming the Space Power & Manufacturing Landscape w/ Cislunar Industries CTO - Joe Pawelski
- Outlook on the various domains of the Space economy- Space as a warfighter domain- Broadening space applications
Machine Identity Management w/ Corsha
- Securing machine-to-machine communication in defense systems- Applying zero trust architecture to military infrastructure- Using AI for threat detection and behavioral analytics
Space Policy & Regulation w/The Office of Space Commerce - Gabriel Swiney Director at the Office of Space Commerce
- US commercial space regulation and policy modernization- International coordination on space law and norms of behavior- Legal frameworks for orbital activities and space sustainability
All Things Space w/ Quantum Space
- Quantum Space's approach to orbital mobility and maneuverability.- GEO vs LEO capabilities and strategic advantages- Recent funding and spacecraft development milestones
US Defense Budget & Strategy w/ CSBA
Current government spending outlook Potential reach of DOGE and impacted areas Post deregulation impact for the A&D sector
Al & The Aerospace Landscape w/ Aeroglity CEO - Malcolm Bridgeford
How Al supports predictive maintenance and fleet readiness Aeroglity's use of Al- driven digital twin technology in aerospace Client adoption trends and barriers to scaling Al in aerospace

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies. CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company. Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
